enum.name: GdkAnchorHints
enum.description:
Positioning hints for aligning a surface relative to a rectangle.
These hints determine how the surface should be positioned in the case that the surface would fall off-screen if placed in its ideal position.
For example, %GDK_ANCHOR_FLIP_X will replace %GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_WEST with %GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_EAST and vice versa if the surface extends beyond the left or right edges of the monitor.
If %GDK_ANCHOR_SLIDE_X is set, the surface can be shifted horizontally to fit on-screen. If %GDK_ANCHOR_RESIZE_X is set, the surface can be shrunken horizontally to fit.
In general, when multiple flags are set, flipping should take precedence over sliding, which should take precedence over resizing.

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_FLIP
parameter.parameter_description: allow flipping anchors on both axes

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_SLIDE
parameter.parameter_description: allow sliding surface on both axes

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_RESIZE
parameter.parameter_description: allow resizing surface on both axes

property.name: GdkAppLaunchContext:display
property.description: The display that the `GdkAppLaunchContext` is on.

enum.name: GdkAxisFlags
enum.description: Flags describing the current capabilities of a device/tool.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_FLAG_DELTA_X
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll X delta axis is present

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_FLAG_DELTA_Y
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll Y delta axis is present

enum.name: GdkAxisUse
enum.description:
Defines how device axes are interpreted by GTK.
Note that the X and Y axes are not really needed; pointer devices report their location via the x/y members of events regardless. Whether X and Y are present as axes depends on the GDK backend.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_X
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the x axis.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_Y
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the y axis.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_DELTA_X
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the scroll x delta

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_DELTA_Y
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the scroll y delta

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_PRESSURE
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pressure information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_XTILT
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for x tilt information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_YTILT
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for y tilt information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_WHEEL
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for wheel information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_DISTANCE
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen/tablet distance information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_ROTATION
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen rotation information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_SLIDER
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen slider information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: a constant equal to the numerically highest axis value.

property.name: GdkCicpParams:color-primaries
property.description:
The color primaries to use.
Supported values:
- 1: BT.709 / sRGB - 2: unspecified - 5: PAL - 6,7: BT.601 / NTSC - 9: BT.2020 - 12: Display P3
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkCicpParams:matrix-coefficients
property.description:
The matrix coefficients (for YUV to RGB conversion).
Supported values:
- 0: RGB - 2: unspecified
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkCicpParams:range
property.description:
Whether the data is using the full range of values.
The range of the data.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkCicpParams:transfer-function
property.description:
The transfer function to use.
Supported values:
- 1,6,14,15: BT.709, BT.601, BT.2020 - 2: unspecified - 4: gamma 2.2 - 5: gamma 2.8 - 8: linear - 13: sRGB - 16: BT.2100 PQ - 18: BT.2100 HLG
Since: 4.16

enum.name: GdkCicpRange
enum.description:
The values of this enumeration describe whether image data uses the full range of 8-bit values.
In digital broadcasting, it is common to reserve the lowest and highest values. Typically the allowed values for the narrow range are 16-235 for Y and 16-240 for u,v (when dealing with YUV data).
Since: 4.16

parameter.name: GDK_CICP_RANGE_NARROW
parameter.parameter_description: The values use the range of 16-235 (for Y) and 16-240 for u and v.

parameter.name: GDK_CICP_RANGE_FULL
parameter.parameter_description: The values use the full range.

enum.description: Specifies the crossing mode for enter and leave events.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_GRAB
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a grab is activated.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_UNGRAB
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a grab is deactivated.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_GTK_GRAB
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a GTK grab is activated.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_GTK_UNGRAB
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a GTK grab is deactivated.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_STATE_CHANGED
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a GTK widget changed state (e.g. sensitivity).

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_TOUCH_BEGIN
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a touch sequence has begun, this event is synthetic as the pointer might have not left the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_TOUCH_END
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because a touch sequence has ended, this event is synthetic as the pointer might have not left the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_CROSSING_DEVICE_SWITCH
parameter.parameter_description: crossing because of a device switch (i.e. a mouse taking control of the pointer after a touch device), this event is synthetic as the pointer didn’t leave the surface.

signal.name: GdkDevice::changed
signal.description:
Emitted either when the number of either axes or keys changes.
On X11 this will normally happen when the physical device routing events through the logical device changes (for example, user switches from the USB mouse to a tablet); in that case the logical device will change to reflect the axes and keys on the new physical device.

property.name: GdkDevice:display

Whether the device has both right-to-left and left-to-right layouts.

Emitted when the destination side has finished reading all data.
The drag object can now free all miscellaneous data.

parameter.name: drag
parameter.parameter_description: The object on which the signal is emitted

signal.description: Emitted when the drop operation is performed on an accepting client.

parameter.name: drag
parameter.parameter_description: The object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GdkDrag:actions
property.description: The possible actions of this drag.

property.name: GdkDrag:content
property.description: The `GdkContentProvider`.

property.name: GdkDrag:device
property.description: The `GdkDevice` that is performing the drag.

property.name: GdkDrag:display
property.description: The `GdkDisplay` that the drag belongs to.

property.name: GdkDrag:formats
property.description: The possible formats that the drag can provide its data in.

property.name: GdkDrag:selected-action
property.description: The currently selected action of the drag.

property.name: GdkDrag:surface
property.description: The surface where the drag originates.

enum.name: GdkDragAction
enum.description: Used in `GdkDrop` and `GdkDrag` to indicate the actions that the destination can and should do with the dropped data.

parameter.name: GDK_ACTION_MOVE
parameter.parameter_description: Move the data, i.e. first copy it, then delete it from the source using the DELETE target of the X selection protocol.

parameter.name: GDK_ACTION_LINK
parameter.parameter_description: Add a link to the data. Note that this is only useful if source and destination agree on what it means, and is not supported on all platforms.

parameter.name: GDK_ACTION_ASK
parameter.parameter_description: Ask the user what to do with the data.

enum.name: GdkDragCancelReason
enum.description: Used in `GdkDrag` to the reason of a cancelled DND operation.

parameter.name: GDK_DRAG_CANCEL_NO_TARGET
parameter.parameter_description: There is no suitable drop target.

signal.name: GdkDragSurface::compute-size
signal.description:
Emitted when the size for the surface needs to be computed, when it is present.
This signal will normally be emitted during the native surface layout cycle when the surface size needs to be recomputed.
It is the responsibility of the drag surface user to handle this signal and compute the desired size of the surface, storing the computed size in the [struct@Gdk.DragSurfaceSize] object that is passed to the signal handler, using [method@Gdk.DragSurfaceSize.set_size].
Failing to set a size so will result in an arbitrary size being used as a result.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the drag surface

property.name: GdkDrawContext:display
property.description: The `GdkDisplay` used to create the `GdkDrawContext`.

property.name: GdkDrawContext:surface
property.description: The `GdkSurface` the context is bound to.

property.name: GdkDrop:actions
property.description: The possible actions for this drop

property.name: GdkDrop:device
property.description: The `GdkDevice` performing the drop

property.name: GdkDrop:display
property.description: The `GdkDisplay` that the drop belongs to.

property.name: GdkDrop:drag
property.description: The `GdkDrag` that initiated this drop

property.name: GdkDrop:formats
property.description: The possible formats that the drop can provide its data in.

property.name: GdkDrop:surface
property.description: The `GdkSurface` the drop happens on

enum.name: GdkEventType
enum.description: Specifies the type of the event.

parameter.name: GDK_DELETE
parameter.parameter_description: the window manager has requested that the toplevel surface be hidden or destroyed, usually when the user clicks on a special icon in the title bar.

parameter.name: GDK_MOTION_NOTIFY
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer (usually a mouse) has moved.

parameter.name: GDK_BUTTON_PRESS
parameter.parameter_description: a mouse button has been pressed.

parameter.name: GDK_BUTTON_RELEASE
parameter.parameter_description: a mouse button has been released.

parameter.name: GDK_ENTER_NOTIFY
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer has entered the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_LEAVE_NOTIFY
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer has left the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_FOCUS_CHANGE
parameter.parameter_description: the keyboard focus has entered or left the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_PROXIMITY_IN
parameter.parameter_description: an input device has moved into contact with a sensing surface (e.g. a touchscreen or graphics tablet).

parameter.name: GDK_PROXIMITY_OUT
parameter.parameter_description: an input device has moved out of contact with a sensing surface.

parameter.name: GDK_DRAG_ENTER
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse has entered the surface while a drag is in progress.

parameter.name: GDK_DRAG_LEAVE
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse has left the surface while a drag is in progress.

parameter.name: GDK_DRAG_MOTION
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse has moved in the surface while a drag is in progress.

parameter.name: GDK_DROP_START
parameter.parameter_description: a drop operation onto the surface has started.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAB_BROKEN
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer or keyboard grab was broken.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCH_BEGIN
parameter.parameter_description: A new touch event sequence has just started.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCH_UPDATE
parameter.parameter_description: A touch event sequence has been updated.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCH_END
parameter.parameter_description: A touch event sequence has finished.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCH_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: A touch event sequence has been canceled.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_SWIPE
parameter.parameter_description: A touchpad swipe gesture event, the current state is determined by its phase field.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_PINCH
parameter.parameter_description: A touchpad pinch gesture event, the current state is determined by its phase field.

parameter.name: GDK_PAD_BUTTON_PRESS
parameter.parameter_description: A tablet pad button press event.

parameter.name: GDK_PAD_BUTTON_RELEASE
parameter.parameter_description: A tablet pad button release event.

parameter.name: GDK_PAD_RING
parameter.parameter_description: A tablet pad axis event from a "ring".

parameter.name: GDK_PAD_STRIP
parameter.parameter_description: A tablet pad axis event from a "strip".

parameter.name: GDK_PAD_GROUP_MODE
parameter.parameter_description: A tablet pad group mode change.

parameter.name: GDK_EVENT_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: marks the end of the GdkEventType enumeration.

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::after-paint
signal.description:
This signal ends processing of the frame.
Applications should generally not handle this signal.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::before-paint
signal.description:
Begins processing of the frame.
Applications should generally not handle this signal.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::flush-events
signal.description:
Used to flush pending motion events that are being batched up and compressed together.
Applications should not handle this signal.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::layout
signal.description:
Emitted as the second step of toolkit and application processing of the frame.
Any work to update sizes and positions of application elements should be performed. GTK normally handles this internally.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::paint
signal.description:
Emitted as the third step of toolkit and application processing of the frame.
The frame is repainted. GDK normally handles this internally and emits [signal@Gdk.Surface::render] signals which are turned into [GtkWidget::snapshot](../gtk4/signal.Widget.snapshot.html) signals by GTK.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::resume-events
signal.description:
Emitted after processing of the frame is finished.
This signal is handled internally by GTK to resume normal event processing. Applications should not handle this signal.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

signal.name: GdkFrameClock::update
signal.description:
Emitted as the first step of toolkit and application processing of the frame.
Animations should be updated using [method@Gdk.FrameClock.get_frame_time]. Applications can connect directly to this signal, or use [gtk_widget_add_tick_callback()](../gtk4/method.Widget.add_tick_callback.html) as a more convenient interface.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the frame clock emitting the signal

enum.name: GdkFrameClockPhase
enum.description:
Used to represent the different paint clock phases that can be requested.
The elements of the enumeration correspond to the signals of `GdkFrameClock`.

parameter.name: GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_FLUSH_EVENTS
parameter.parameter_description: corresponds to GdkFrameClock::flush-events. Should not be handled by applications.

parameter.name: GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_BEFORE_PAINT
parameter.parameter_description: corresponds to GdkFrameClock::before-paint. Should not be handled by applications.

parameter.name: GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_LAYOUT
parameter.parameter_description: corresponds to GdkFrameClock::layout. Should not be handled by applications.

parameter.name: GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_RESUME_EVENTS
parameter.parameter_description: corresponds to GdkFrameClock::resume-events. Should not be handled by applications.

parameter.name: GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_AFTER_PAINT
parameter.parameter_description: corresponds to GdkFrameClock::after-paint. Should not be handled by applications.

parameter.name: GDK_FULLSCREEN_ON_ALL_MONITORS

enum.name: GdkGravity
enum.description: Defines the reference point of a surface and is used in `GdkPopupLayout`.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_WEST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the top left corner.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is in the middle of the top edge.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_EAST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the top right corner.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_WEST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the middle of the left edge.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_CENTER
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the center of the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_EAST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the middle of the right edge.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH_WEST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the lower left corner.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the middle of the lower edge.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH_EAST
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the lower right corner.

parameter.name: GDK_GRAVITY_STATIC
parameter.parameter_description: the reference point is at the top left corner of the surface itself, ignoring window manager decorations.

enum.name: GdkInputSource
enum.description: An enumeration describing the type of an input device in general terms.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_MOUSE
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a mouse. (This will be reported for the core pointer, even if it is something else, such as a trackball.)

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_PEN
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a stylus of a graphics tablet or similar device.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a direct-input touch device, such as a touchscreen or tablet

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHPAD
parameter.parameter_description: the device is an indirect touch device, such as a touchpad

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TABLET_PAD
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a "pad", a collection of buttons, rings and strips found in drawing tablets

enum.name: GdkInterpType
enum.description:
Interpolation modes for scaling functions.
The `GDK_INTERP_NEAREST` mode is the fastest scaling method, but has horrible quality when scaling down; `GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR` is the best choice if you aren't sure what to choose, it has a good speed/quality balance.
**Note**: Cubic filtering is missing from the list; hyperbolic interpolation is just as fast and results in higher quality.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_NEAREST
parameter.parameter_description: Nearest neighbor sampling; this is the fastest and lowest quality mode. Quality is normally unacceptable when scaling down, but may be OK when scaling up.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_TILES
parameter.parameter_description: This is an accurate simulation of the PostScript image operator without any interpolation enabled. Each pixel is rendered as a tiny parallelogram of solid color, the edges of which are implemented with antialiasing. It resembles nearest neighbor for enlargement, and bilinear for reduction.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: Best quality/speed balance; use this mode by default. Bilinear interpolation. For enlargement, it is equivalent to point-sampling the ideal bilinear-interpolated image. For reduction, it is equivalent to laying down small tiles and integrating over the coverage area.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_HYPER
parameter.parameter_description: This is the slowest and highest quality reconstruction function. It is derived from the hyperbolic filters in Wolberg's "Digital Image Warping", and is formally defined as the hyperbolic-filter sampling the ideal hyperbolic-filter interpolated image (the filter is designed to be idempotent for 1:1 pixel mapping). **Deprecated**: this interpolation filter is deprecated, as in reality it has a lower quality than the @GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR filter (Since: 2.38)

enum.name: GdkKeyMatch
enum.description:
Describes how well an event matches a given keyval and modifiers.
`GdkKeyMatch` values are returned by [method@Gdk.KeyEvent.matches].

parameter.name: GDK_KEY_MATCH_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: The key event does not match

parameter.name: GDK_KEY_MATCH_PARTIAL
parameter.parameter_description: The key event matches if keyboard state (specifically, the currently active group) is ignored

signal.name: GdkKeymap::direction-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the direction of the keymap changes.
See gdk_keymap_get_direction().

parameter.name: keymap
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkKeymap::keys-changed
signal.description: The ::keys-changed signal is emitted when the mapping represented by @keymap changes.

parameter.name: keymap
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkKeymap::state-changed
signal.description: The ::state-changed signal is emitted when the state of the keyboard changes, e.g when Caps Lock is turned on or off. See gdk_keymap_get_caps_lock_state().

parameter.name: keymap
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GdkMemoryFormat
enum.description:
`GdkMemoryFormat` describes formats that image data can have in memory.
It describes formats by listing the contents of the memory passed to it. So `GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8` will be 1 byte (8 bits) of alpha, followed by a byte each of red, green and blue. It is not endian-dependent, so `CAIRO_FORMAT_ARGB32` is represented by different `GdkMemoryFormats` on architectures with different endiannesses.
Its naming is modelled after [VkFormat](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0/html/vkspec.html#VkFormat) for details).

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8A8_PREMULTIPLIED
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for blue, green, red, alpha. The color values are premultiplied with the alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8_PREMULTIPLIED
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, red, green, blue. The color values are premultiplied with the alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R8G8B8A8_PREMULTIPLIED
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for red, green, blue, alpha The color values are premultiplied with the alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8A8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for blue, green, red, alpha.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, red, green, blue.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R8G8B8A8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for red, green, blue, alpha.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8B8G8R8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, blue, green, red.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R8G8B8
parameter.parameter_description: 3 bytes; for red, green, blue. The data is opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8
parameter.parameter_description: 3 bytes; for blue, green, red. The data is opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_N_FORMATS
parameter.parameter_description: The number of formats. This value will change as more formats get added, so do not rely on its concrete integer.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R32G32B32_FLOAT
parameter.parameter_description: 3 float values; for red, green, blue.

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:bytes
property.description:
The bytes holding the data.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:color-state
property.description:
The colorstate describing the data.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:format
property.description:
The format of the data.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:height
property.description:
The height of the texture.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:stride
property.description:
The rowstride of the texture.
The rowstride is the number of bytes between the first pixel in a row of image data, and the first pixel in the next row.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:update-region
property.description:
The update region for [property@Gdk.MemoryTextureBuilder:update-texture].
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:update-texture
property.description:
The texture [property@Gdk.MemoryTextureBuilder:update-region] is an update for.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkMemoryTextureBuilder:width
property.description:
The width of the texture.
Since: 4.16

enum.name: GdkModifierType
enum.description:
Flags to indicate the state of modifier keys and mouse buttons in events.
Typical modifier keys are Shift, Control, Meta, Super, Hyper, Alt, Compose, Apple, CapsLock or ShiftLock.
Note that GDK may add internal values to events which include values outside of this enumeration. Your code should preserve and ignore them. You can use %GDK_MODIFIER_MASK to remove all private values.

parameter.name: GDK_LOCK_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: a Lock key (depending on the modifier mapping of the X server this may either be CapsLock or ShiftLock).

parameter.name: GDK_ALT_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: the fourth modifier key (it depends on the modifier mapping of the X server which key is interpreted as this modifier, but normally it is the Alt key).

parameter.name: GDK_META_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: the Meta modifier. Maps to Command on macOS.

signal.name: GdkMonitor::invalidate
signal.description: Emitted when the output represented by @monitor gets disconnected.

parameter.name: monitor
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which this signal was emitted

property.name: GdkMonitor:connector
property.description: The connector name.

property.name: GdkMonitor:description
property.description:
A short description of the monitor, meant for display to the user.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GdkMonitor:display
property.description: The `GdkDisplay` of the monitor.

property.name: GdkMonitor:geometry
property.description: The geometry of the monitor.

property.name: GdkMonitor:height-mm
property.description: The height of the monitor, in millimeters.

property.name: GdkMonitor:manufacturer
property.description: The manufacturer name.

property.name: GdkMonitor:model
property.description: The model name.

property.name: GdkMonitor:refresh-rate
property.description: The refresh rate, in milli-Hertz.

property.name: GdkMonitor:scale
property.description:
The scale of the monitor.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GdkMonitor:scale-factor
property.description:
The scale factor.
The scale factor is the next larger integer, compared to [property@Gdk.Surface:scale].

property.name: GdkMonitor:subpixel-layout
property.description: The subpixel layout.

property.name: GdkMonitor:valid
property.description: Whether the object is still valid.

property.name: GdkMonitor:width-mm
property.description: The width of the monitor, in millimeters.

enum.name: GdkNotifyType
enum.description:
Specifies the kind of crossing for enter and leave events.
See the X11 protocol specification of LeaveNotify for full details of crossing event generation.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_ANCESTOR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from an ancestor or left towards an ancestor.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_VIRTUAL
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer moves between an ancestor and an inferior of the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_INFERIOR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from an inferior or left towards an inferior.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from or left towards a surface which is neither an ancestor nor an inferior.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR_VIRTUAL
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer moves between two surfaces which are not ancestors of each other and the surface is part of the ancestor chain between one of these surfaces and their least common ancestor.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: an unknown type of enter/leave event occurred.

signal.name: GdkPaintable::invalidate-contents
signal.description:
Emitted when the contents of the @paintable change.
Examples for such an event would be videos changing to the next frame or the icon theme for an icon changing.

signal.name: GdkPaintable::invalidate-size
signal.description:
Emitted when the intrinsic size of the @paintable changes.
This means the values reported by at least one of [method@Gdk.Paintable.get_intrinsic_width], [method@Gdk.Paintable.get_intrinsic_height] or [method@Gdk.Paintable.get_intrinsic_aspect_ratio] has changed.
Examples for such an event would be a paintable displaying the contents of a toplevel surface being resized.

enum.name: GdkPaintableFlags
enum.description:
Flags about a paintable object.
Implementations use these for optimizations such as caching.

parameter.name: GDK_PAINTABLE_STATIC_SIZE
parameter.parameter_description: The size is immutable. The [signal@Gdk.Paintable::invalidate-size] signal will never be emitted.

parameter.name: GDK_PAINTABLE_STATIC_CONTENTS
parameter.parameter_description: The content is immutable. The [signal@Gdk.Paintable::invalidate-contents] signal will never be emitted.

signal.name: GdkPixbuf::pixel-bytes
signal.description:
If set, this pixbuf was created from read-only #GBytes.
Replaces GdkPixbuf::pixels.
Since: 2.32

property.name: GdkPixbuf:bits-per-sample
property.description:
The number of bits per sample.
Currently only 8 bit per sample are supported.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:colorspace
property.description:
The color space of the pixbuf.
Currently, only `GDK_COLORSPACE_RGB` is supported.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:has-alpha
property.description: Whether the pixbuf has an alpha channel.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:height
property.description: The number of rows of the pixbuf.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:n-channels
property.description:
The number of samples per pixel.
Currently, only 3 or 4 samples per pixel are supported.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:pixels
property.description: A pointer to the pixel data of the pixbuf.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:rowstride
property.description:
The number of bytes between the start of a row and the start of the next row.
This number must (obviously) be at least as large as the width of the pixbuf.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:width
property.description: The number of columns of the pixbuf.

enum.name: GdkPixbufAlphaMode
enum.description:
Control the alpha channel for drawables.
These values can be passed to gdk_pixbuf_xlib_render_to_drawable_alpha() in gdk-pixbuf-xlib to control how the alpha channel of an image should be handled.
This function can create a bilevel clipping mask (black and white) and use it while painting the image.
In the future, when the X Window System gets an alpha channel extension, it will be possible to do full alpha compositing onto arbitrary drawables. For now both cases fall back to a bilevel clipping mask.
Deprecated: 2.42: There is no user of GdkPixbufAlphaMode in GdkPixbuf, and the Xlib utility functions have been split out to their own library, gdk-pixbuf-xlib

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_BILEVEL
parameter.parameter_description: A bilevel clipping mask (black and white) will be created and used to draw the image. Pixels below 0.5 opacity will be considered fully transparent, and all others will be considered fully opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_FULL
parameter.parameter_description: For now falls back to #GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_BILEVEL. In the future it will do full alpha compositing.

enum.name: GdkPixbufError
enum.description:
An error code in the `GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR` domain.
Many gdk-pixbuf operations can cause errors in this domain, or in the `G_FILE_ERROR` domain.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_CORRUPT_IMAGE
parameter.parameter_description: An image file was broken somehow.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_BAD_OPTION
parameter.parameter_description: A bad option was passed to a pixbuf save module.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION
parameter.parameter_description: Don't know how to perform the given operation on the type of image at hand.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: Generic failure code, something went wrong.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_INCOMPLETE_ANIMATION
parameter.parameter_description: Only part of the animation was loaded.

enum.name: GdkPixbufFormatFlags
enum.description:
Flags which allow a module to specify further details about the supported operations.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_FORMAT_WRITABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the module can write out images in the format.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_FORMAT_THREADSAFE
parameter.parameter_description: the module is threadsafe. gdk-pixbuf ignores modules that are not marked as threadsafe. (Since 2.28).

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::area-prepared
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the pixbuf loader has allocated the pixbuf in the desired size.
After this signal is emitted, applications can call gdk_pixbuf_loader_get_pixbuf() to fetch the partially-loaded pixbuf.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::area-updated
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when a significant area of the image being loaded has been updated.
Normally it means that a complete scanline has been read in, but it could be a different area as well.
Applications can use this signal to know when to repaint areas of an image that is being loaded.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: X offset of upper-left corner of the updated area.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Y offset of upper-left corner of the updated area.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::closed
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when gdk_pixbuf_loader_close() is called.
It can be used by different parts of an application to receive notification when an image loader is closed by the code that drives it.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::size-prepared
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the pixbuf loader has been fed the initial amount of data that is required to figure out the size of the image that it will create.
Applications can call gdk_pixbuf_loader_set_size() in response to this signal to set the desired size to which the image should be scaled.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the original width of the image

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the original height of the image

enum.name: GdkPixbufRotation
enum.description:
The possible rotations which can be passed to gdk_pixbuf_rotate_simple().
To make them easier to use, their numerical values are the actual degrees.

property.name: GdkPixbufSimpleAnim:loop
property.description:
Whether the animation should loop when it reaches the end.
Since: 2.18

enum.name: GdkPixdataDumpType
enum.description:
An enumeration which is used by gdk_pixdata_to_csource() to determine the form of C source to be generated. The three values @GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STREAM, @GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STRUCT and @GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_MACROS are mutually exclusive, as are @GDK_PIXBUF_DUMP_GTYPES and @GDK_PIXBUF_DUMP_CTYPES. The remaining elements are optional flags that can be freely added.
Deprecated: 2.32

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STREAM
parameter.parameter_description: Generate pixbuf data stream (a single string containing a serialized #GdkPixdata structure in network byte order).

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STRUCT
parameter.parameter_description: Generate #GdkPixdata structure (needs the #GdkPixdata structure definition from gdk-pixdata.h).

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_MACROS
parameter.parameter_description: Generate <function>*_ROWSTRIDE</function>, <function>*_WIDTH</function>, <function>*_HEIGHT</function>, <function>*_BYTES_PER_PIXEL</function> and <function>*_RLE_PIXEL_DATA</function> or <function>*_PIXEL_DATA</function> macro definitions for the image.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_GTYPES
parameter.parameter_description: Generate GLib data types instead of standard C data types.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_CTYPES
parameter.parameter_description: Generate standard C data types instead of GLib data types.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_RLE_DECODER
parameter.parameter_description: Provide a <function>*_RUN_LENGTH_DECODE(image_buf, rle_data, size, bpp)</function> macro definition to decode run-length encoded image data.

enum.name: GdkPixdataType
enum.description:
An enumeration containing three sets of flags for a #GdkPixdata struct: one for the used colorspace, one for the width of the samples and one for the encoding of the pixel data.
Deprecated: 2.32

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: each pixel has red, green and blue samples.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_RGBA
parameter.parameter_description: each pixel has red, green and blue samples and an alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the colortype flags of the enum.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_SAMPLE_WIDTH_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the sample width flags of the enum.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_RAW
parameter.parameter_description: the pixel data is in raw form.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_RLE
parameter.parameter_description: the pixel data is run-length encoded. Runs may be up to 127 bytes long; their length is stored in a single byte preceding the pixel data for the run. If a run is constant, its length byte has the high bit set and the pixel data consists of a single pixel which must be repeated.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the encoding flags of the enum.

property.name: GdkPopup:autohide
property.description: Whether to hide on outside clicks.

property.name: GdkPopup:parent
property.description: The parent surface.

enum.name: GdkScrollDirection
enum.description: Specifies the direction for scroll events.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is scrolled to the left.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is scrolled to the right.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_SMOOTH
parameter.parameter_description: the scrolling is determined by the delta values in scroll events. See gdk_scroll_event_get_deltas()

enum.name: GdkScrollUnit
enum.description:
Specifies the unit of scroll deltas.
When you get %GDK_SCROLL_UNIT_WHEEL, a delta of 1.0 means 1 wheel detent click in the south direction, 2.0 means 2 wheel detent clicks in the south direction... This is the same logic for negative values but in the north direction.
If you get %GDK_SCROLL_UNIT_SURFACE, are managing a scrollable view and get a value of 123, you have to scroll 123 surface logical pixels right if it's @delta_x or down if it's @delta_y. This is the same logic for negative values but you have to scroll left instead of right if it's @delta_x and up instead of down if it's @delta_y.
1 surface logical pixel is equal to 1 real screen pixel multiplied by the final scale factor of your graphical interface (the product of the desktop scale factor and eventually a custom scale factor in your app).
Since: 4.8

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_UNIT_WHEEL
parameter.parameter_description: The delta is in number of wheel clicks.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_UNIT_SURFACE
parameter.parameter_description: The delta is in surface pixels to scroll directly on screen.

signal.name: GdkSeat::device-added
signal.description: Emitted when a new input device is related to this seat.

parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkSeat::device-removed

parameter.name: seat
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkSeat::tool-added
signal.description:
Emitted whenever a new tool is made known to the seat.
The tool may later be assigned to a device (i.e. on proximity with a tablet). The device will emit the [signal@Gdk.Device::tool-changed] signal accordingly.
A same tool may be used by several devices.

parameter.name: tool

signal.name: GdkSeat::tool-removed
signal.description: Emitted whenever a tool is no longer known to this @seat.

parameter.name: seat

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_POINTER

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_TABLET_STYLUS
parameter.parameter_description: The seat has drawing tablet(s) attached

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_TABLET_PAD
parameter.parameter_description: The seat has drawing tablet pad(s) attached

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_ALL_POINTING
parameter.parameter_description: The union of all pointing capabilities

enum.name: GdkSubpixelLayout
enum.description: This enumeration describes how the red, green and blue components of physical pixels on an output device are laid out.

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HORIZONTAL_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is horizontal, the order is RGB

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HORIZONTAL_BGR
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is horizontal, the order is BGR

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VERTICAL_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is vertical, the order is RGB

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VERTICAL_BGR
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is vertical, the order is BGR

signal.name: GdkSurface::enter-monitor

signal.name: GdkSurface::event

signal.name: GdkSurface::layout

Surface size is reported in ”application pixels”, not ”device pixels” (see gdk_surface_get_scale_factor()).

signal.name: GdkSurface::leave-monitor

signal.name: GdkSurface::render
signal.description: Emitted when part of the surface needs to be redrawn.

parameter.name: region
parameter.parameter_description: the region that needs to be redrawn

signal.return: %TRUE to indicate that the signal has been handled

property.name: GdkSurface:cursor

property.name: GdkSurface:display

property.name: GdkSurface:frame-clock

property.name: GdkSurface:height
property.description: The height of the surface, in pixels.

property.name: GdkSurface:mapped
property.description: Whether the surface is mapped.

property.name: GdkSurface:scale
property.description:
The scale of the surface.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GdkSurface:scale-factor
property.description:
The scale factor of the surface.
The scale factor is the next larger integer, compared to [property@Gdk.Surface:scale].

property.name: GdkSurface:width
property.description: The width of the surface in pixels.

enum.name: GdkSurfaceEdge
enum.description: Determines a surface edge or corner.

property.name: GdkTexture:color-state
property.description:
The color state of the texture.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GdkTexture:height
property.description: The height of the texture, in pixels.

property.name: GdkTexture:width

enum.name: GdkTextureError
enum.description:
Possible errors that can be returned by `GdkTexture` constructors.
Since: 4.6

parameter.name: GDK_TEXTURE_ERROR_TOO_LARGE
parameter.parameter_description: Not enough memory to handle this image

parameter.name: GDK_TEXTURE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_CONTENT
parameter.parameter_description: The image contains features that cannot be loaded

parameter.name: GDK_TEXTURE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT
parameter.parameter_description: The image format is not supported

enum.name: GdkTitlebarGesture
enum.description:
The kind of title bar gesture to emit with [method@Gdk.Toplevel.titlebar_gesture].
Since: 4.4

signal.name: GdkToplevel::compute-size
signal.description:
Emitted when the size for the surface needs to be computed, when it is present.
This signal will normally be emitted during or after a call to [method@Gdk.Toplevel.present], depending on the configuration received by the windowing system. It may also be emitted at any other point in time, in response to the windowing system spontaneously changing the configuration of the toplevel surface.
It is the responsibility of the toplevel user to handle this signal and compute the desired size of the toplevel, given the information passed via the [struct@Gdk.ToplevelSize] object. Failing to do so will result in an arbitrary size being used as a result.

property.name: GdkToplevel:autohide
property.description: Whether the toplevel should be modal with respect to its parent.

property.name: GdkToplevel:decorated
property.description: Whether the window manager should add decorations.

property.name: GdkToplevel:deletable
property.description: Whether the window manager should allow to close the surface.

property.name: GdkToplevel:fullscreen-mode
property.description: The fullscreen mode of the surface.

property.name: GdkToplevel:icon-list
property.description: A list of textures to use as icon.

property.name: GdkToplevel:modal
property.description: Whether the surface is modal.

property.name: GdkToplevel:parent
property.description: The parent surface of the toplevel.

property.name: GdkToplevel:shortcuts-inhibited
property.description: Whether the surface should inhibit keyboard shortcuts.

property.name: GdkToplevel:startup-id
property.description:
The startup ID of the surface.
See [class@Gdk.AppLaunchContext] for more information about startup feedback.

property.name: GdkToplevel:state
property.description: The state of the toplevel.

property.name: GdkToplevel:title
property.description: The title of the surface.

property.name: GdkToplevel:transient-for
property.description: The transient parent of the surface.

enum.name: GdkToplevelState
enum.description:
Specifies the state of a toplevel surface.
On platforms that support information about individual edges, the %GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_TILED state will be set whenever any of the individual tiled states is set. On platforms that lack that support, the tiled state will give an indication of tiledness without any of the per-edge states being set.

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_FULLSCREEN
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is maximized without decorations

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_ABOVE
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is kept above other surfaces

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_BELOW
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is kept below other surfaces

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_FOCUSED
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is presented as focused (with active decorations)

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is in a tiled state

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_TOP_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the top edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_TOP_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the top edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_RIGHT_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the right edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_RIGHT_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the right edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_BOTTOM_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the bottom edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_BOTTOM_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the bottom edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_LEFT_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the left edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_TOPLEVEL_STATE_LEFT_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the left edge is resizable

enum.name: GdkTouchpadGesturePhase
enum.description:
Specifies the current state of a touchpad gesture.
All gestures are guaranteed to begin with an event with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_BEGIN, followed by 0 or several events with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_UPDATE.
A finished gesture may have 2 possible outcomes, an event with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_END will be emitted when the gesture is considered successful, this should be used as the hint to perform any permanent changes.
Cancelled gestures may be so for a variety of reasons, due to hardware or the compositor, or due to the gesture recognition layers hinting the gesture did not finish resolutely (eg. a 3rd finger being added during a pinch gesture). In these cases, the last event will report the phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_CANCEL, this should be used as a hint to undo any visible/permanent changes that were done throughout the progress of the gesture.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_END
parameter.parameter_description: The gesture was finished, changes should be permanently applied.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: The gesture was cancelled, all changes should be undone.

signal.name: GdkVulkanContext::images-updated
signal.description:
Emitted when the images managed by this context have changed.
Usually this means that the swapchain had to be recreated, for example in response to a change of the surface size.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GdkVulkanError
enum.description: Error enumeration for `GdkVulkanContext`.

parameter.name: GDK_VULKAN_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED
parameter.parameter_description: Vulkan is not supported on this backend or has not been compiled in.

parameter.name: GDK_VULKAN_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Vulkan support is not available on this Surface

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_get_display
function.description: Gets the `GdkDisplay` that @context is for.

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_desktop
function.description:
Sets the workspace on which applications will be launched.
This only works when running under a window manager that supports multiple workspaces, as described in the [Extended Window Manager Hints](http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/wm-spec). Specifically this sets the `_NET_WM_DESKTOP` property described in that spec.
This only works when using the X11 backend.
When the workspace is not specified or @desktop is set to -1, it is up to the window manager to pick one, typically it will be the current workspace.

parameter.name: desktop
parameter.parameter_description: the number of a workspace, or -1

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon
function.description:
Sets the icon for applications that are launched with this context.
Window Managers can use this information when displaying startup notification.
See also [method@Gdk.AppLaunchContext.set_icon_name].

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon for applications that are launched with this context.
The @icon_name will be interpreted in the same way as the Icon field in desktop files. See also [method@Gdk.AppLaunchContext.set_icon].
If both @icon and @icon_name are set, the @icon_name takes priority. If neither @icon or @icon_name is set, the icon is taken from either the file that is passed to launched application or from the `GAppInfo` for the launched application itself.

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_timestamp
function.description:
Sets the timestamp of @context.
The timestamp should ideally be taken from the event that triggered the launch.
Window managers can use this information to avoid moving the focus to the newly launched application when the user is busy typing in another window. This is also known as 'focus stealing prevention'.

function.name: gdk_button_event_get_button
function.description: Extract the button number from a button event.

function.name: gdk_cairo_context_cairo_create
function.description:
Retrieves a Cairo context to be used to draw on the `GdkSurface` of @context.
A call to [method@Gdk.DrawContext.begin_frame] with this @context must have been done or this function will return %NULL.
The returned context is guaranteed to be valid until [method@Gdk.DrawContext.end_frame] is called.
function.return: a Cairo context to draw on `GdkSurface

function.name: gdk_cairo_draw_from_gl
function.description:
The main way to not draw GL content in GTK.
It takes a render buffer ID (@source_type == GL_RENDERBUFFER) or a texture id (@source_type == GL_TEXTURE) and draws it onto @cr with an OVER operation, respecting the current clip. The top left corner of the rectangle specified by @x, @y, @width and @height will be drawn at the current (0,0) position of the `cairo_t`.
This will work for *all* `cairo_t`, as long as @surface is realized, but the fallback implementation that reads back the pixels from the buffer may be used in the general case. In the case of direct drawing to a surface with no special effects applied to @cr it will however use a more efficient approach.
For GL_RENDERBUFFER the code will always fall back to software for buffers with alpha components, so make sure you use GL_TEXTURE if using alpha.
Calling this may change the current GL context.
Deprecated: 4.6: The function is overly complex and produces broken output in various combinations of arguments. If you want to draw with GL textures in GTK, use [ctor@Gdk.GLTexture.new]; if you want to use that texture in Cairo, use [method@Gdk.Texture.download] to download the data into a Cairo image surface.

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: The surface we're rendering for (not necessarily into)

parameter.name: source
parameter.parameter_description: The GL ID of the source buffer

parameter.name: buffer_scale
parameter.parameter_description: The scale-factor that the @source buffer is allocated for

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The source x position in @source to start copying from in GL coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The source y position in @source to start copying from in GL coordinates

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: The width of the region to draw

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: The height of the region to draw

function.name: gdk_cairo_rectangle
function.description: Adds the given rectangle to the current path of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cairo_region
function.description: Adds the given region to the current path of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cairo_region_create_from_surface
function.description:
Creates region that covers the area where the given @surface is more than 50% opaque.
This function takes into account device offsets that might be set with cairo_surface_set_device_offset().

function.name: gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets the given pixbuf as the source pattern for @cr.
The pattern has an extend mode of %CAIRO_EXTEND_NONE and is aligned so that the origin of @pixbuf is @pixbuf_x, @pixbuf_y.

parameter.name: pixbuf_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

parameter.name: pixbuf_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

function.name: gdk_cairo_set_source_rgba
function.description: Sets the specified `GdkRGBA` as the source color of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_build_color_state
function.description:
Creates a new `GdkColorState` object for the cicp parameters in @self.
Note that this may fail if the cicp parameters in @self are not supported by GTK. In that case, `NULL` is returned, and @error is set with an error message that can be presented to the user.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_get_color_primaries
function.description:
Returns the value of the color-primaries property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_get_matrix_coefficients
function.description:
Gets the matrix-coefficients property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_get_range
function.description:
Gets the range property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_get_transfer_function
function.description:
Gets the transfer-function property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GdkCicpParams` object.
The initial values of the properties are the values for "undefined" and need to be set before a color state object can be built.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_set_color_primaries
function.description:
Sets the color-primaries property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_set_matrix_coefficients
gdk_cicp_params_set_range
function.description:
Sets the range property of @self
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_cicp_params_set_transfer_function
function.description:
Sets the transfer-function property of @self.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_content
function.description:
Returns the `GdkContentProvider` currently set on @clipboard.
If the @clipboard is empty or its contents are not owned by the current process, %NULL will be returned.
function.return: The content of a clipboard if the clipboard does not maintain any content

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_display
function.description: Gets the `GdkDisplay` that the clipboard was created for.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_formats
function.description: Gets the formats that the clipboard can provide its current contents in.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_is_local
function.description:
Returns if the clipboard is local.
A clipboard is considered local if it was last claimed by the running application.
Note that [method@Gdk.Clipboard.get_content] may return %NULL even on a local clipboard. In this case the clipboard is empty.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_async
function.description:
Asynchronously requests an input stream to read the @clipboard's contents from.
The clipboard will choose the most suitable mime type from the given list to fulfill the request, preferring the ones listed first.

parameter.name: mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated array of mime types to choose from

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the I/O priority of the request

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_finish
function.description:
Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read.
See [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_async].

parameter.name: out_mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the chosen mime type

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a `GError` location to store the error occurring

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_text_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to a string.
This is a simple wrapper around [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_value_async]. Use that function or [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_async] directly if you need more control over the operation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_text_finish
function.description:
Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read.
See [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_text_async].

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a `GError` location to store the error occurring

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_texture_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to a `GdkPixbuf`.
This is a simple wrapper around [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_value_async]. Use that function or [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_async] directly if you need more control over the operation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_texture_finish
function.description:
Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read.
See [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_texture_async].

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a `GError` location to store the error occurring

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_value_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to the given @type.
For local clipboard contents that are available in the given `GType`, the value will be copied directly. Otherwise, GDK will try to use [func@content_deserialize_async] to convert the clipboard's data.

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the I/O priority of the request

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_value_finish
function.description:
Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read.
See [method@Gdk.Clipboard.read_value_async].

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a GError` location to store the error occurring

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set
function.description:
Sets the clipboard to contain the value collected from the given varargs.
Values should be passed the same way they are passed to other value collecting APIs, such as [method@GObject.Object.set] or [func@GObject.signal_emit].
```c gdk_clipboard_set (clipboard, GTK_TYPE_STRING, "Hello World");
gdk_clipboard_set (clipboard, GDK_TYPE_TEXTURE, some_texture); ```

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_content
function.description:
Sets a new content provider on @clipboard.
The clipboard will claim the `GdkDisplay`'s resources and advertise these new contents to other applications.
In the rare case of a failure, this function will return %FALSE. The clipboard will then continue reporting its old contents and ignore @provider.
If the contents are read by either an external application or the @clipboard's read functions, @clipboard will select the best format to transfer the contents and then request that format from @provider.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: the new contents of @clipboard or %NULL to clear the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_text
function.description: Puts the given @text into the clipboard.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: Text to put into the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_texture
function.description: Puts the given @texture into the clipboard.

parameter.name: texture
parameter.parameter_description: a `GdkTexture` to put into the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_valist
function.description: Sets the clipboard to contain the value collected from the given @args.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_value
function.description: Sets the @clipboard to contain the given @value.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_store_async
function.description:
Asynchronously instructs the @clipboard to store its contents remotely.
If the clipboard is not local, this function does nothing but report success.
The purpose of this call is to preserve clipboard contents beyond the lifetime of an application, so this function is typically called on exit. Depending on the platform, the functionality may not be available unless a "clipboard manager" is running.
This function is called automatically when a [GtkApplication](../gtk4/class.Application.html) is shut down, so you likely don't need to call it.

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the I/O priority of the request

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data:
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_store_finish
function.description:
Finishes an asynchronous clipboard store.
See [method@Gdk.Clipboard.store_async].

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a `GError` location to store the error occurring

function.name: gdk_color_state_create_cicp_params
function.description:
Create a [class@Gdk.CicpParams] representing the colorstate.
It is not guaranteed that every `GdkColorState` can be represented with Cicp parameters. If that is the case, this function returns `NULL`.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_color_state_equal
function.description:
Compares two `GdkColorStates` for equality.
Note that this function is not guaranteed to be perfect and two objects describing the same color state may compare not equal. However, different color states will never compare equal.
Since: 4.16
function.return: %TRUE if the two color states compare equal

function.name: gdk_color_state_get_rec2100_linear
function.description:
Returns the color state object representing the linear rec2100 color space.
This color state uses the primaries defined by BT.2020-2 and BT.2100-0 and a linear transfer function.
It is equivalent to the [Cicp](class.CicpParams.html) tuple 9/8/0/1.
See e.g. [the CSS HDR Module](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-hdr/#valdef-color-rec2100-linear) for details about this colorstate.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the color state object for linearized rec2100

function.name: gdk_color_state_get_rec2100_pq
function.description:
Returns the color state object representing the rec2100-pq color space.
This color state uses the primaries defined by BT.2020-2 and BT.2100-0 and the transfer function defined by SMPTE ST 2084 and BT.2100-2.
It is equivalent to the [Cicp](class.CicpParams.html) tuple 9/16/0/1.
See e.g. [the CSS HDR Module](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-hdr/#valdef-color-rec2100-pq) for details about this colorstate.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the color state object for rec2100-pq

function.name: gdk_color_state_get_srgb
function.description:
Returns the color state object representing the sRGB color space.
This color state uses the primaries defined by BT.709-6 and the transfer function defined by IEC 61966-2-1.
It is equivalent to the [Cicp](class.CicpParams.html) tuple 1/13/0/1.
See e.g. [the CSS Color Module](https://www.w3.org/TR/css-color-4/#predefined-sRGB) for details about this colorstate.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the color state object for sRGB

function.name: gdk_color_state_get_srgb_linear
function.description:
Returns the color state object representing the linearized sRGB color space.
This color state uses the primaries defined by BT.709-6 and a linear transfer function.
It is equivalent to the [Cicp](class.CicpParams.html) tuple 1/8/0/1.
See e.g. [the CSS Color Module](https://www.w3.org/TR/css-color-4/#predefined-sRGB-linear) for details about this colorstate.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the color state object for linearized sRGB

function.name: gdk_color_state_ref
function.description:
Increase the reference count of @self.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the object that was passed in

function.name: gdk_color_state_unref
function.description:
Decrease the reference count of @self.
Unless @self is static, it will be freed when the reference count reaches zero.
Since: 4.16

function.name: gdk_content_deserialize_async
function.description:
Read content from the given input stream and deserialize it, asynchronously.
The default I/O priority is %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT (i.e. 0), and lower numbers indicate a higher priority.

parameter.name: stream
parameter.parameter_description: a `GInputStream` to read the serialized content from

parameter.name: mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: the mime type to deserialize from

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the I/O priority of the operation

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the operation is done

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the callback function

function.name: gdk_content_deserialize_finish
function.description: Finishes a content deserialization operation.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the result of the operation

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_cancellable
function.description:
Gets the cancellable for the current operation.
This is the `GCancellable` that was passed to [func@Gdk.content_deserialize_async].
function.return: the cancellable for the current operation

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_gtype
function.description: Gets the `GType` to create an instance of.

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_input_stream
function.description:
Gets the input stream for the current operation.
This is the stream that was passed to [func@Gdk.content_deserialize_async].
function.return: the input stream for the current operation

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_mime_type
function.description: Gets the mime type to deserialize from.
function.return: the mime type for the current operation

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_priority
function.description:
Gets the I/O priority for the current operation.
This is the priority that was passed to [func@Gdk.content_deserialize_async].
function.return: the I/O priority for the current operation

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_task_data
function.description:
Gets the data that was associated with the current operation.
See [method@Gdk.ContentDeserializer.set_task_data].

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_user_data
function.description: Gets the user data that was passed when the deserializer was registered.
function.return: the user data for this deserializer

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_get_value
function.description: Gets the `GValue` to store the deserialized object in.

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_return_error
function.description:
Indicate that the deserialization has ended with an error.
This function consumes @error.

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_return_success
function.description: Indicate that the deserialization has been successfully completed.

function.name: gdk_content_deserializer_set_task_data
function.description: Associate data with the current deserialization operation.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to associate with this operation

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_formats
function.description: Appends all formats from @formats to @builder, skipping those that already exist.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_gtype
function.description: Appends @type to @builder if it has not already been added.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_mime_type
function.description: Appends @mime_type to @builder if it has not already been added.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_free_to_formats
function.description: Creates a new `GdkContentFormats` from the current state of the given @builder, and frees the @builder instance.
function.return: the newly created `GdkContentFormats` with all the formats added to @builder

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_new
function.description:
Create a new `GdkContentFormatsBuilder` object.
The resulting builder would create an empty `GdkContentFormats`. Use addition functions to add types to it.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_ref
function.description:
Acquires a reference on the given @builder.
This function is intended primarily for bindings. `GdkContentFormatsBuilder` objects should not be kept around.
function.return: the given `GdkContentFormatsBuilder` with its reference count increased

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_to_formats
function.description:
Creates a new `GdkContentFormats` from the given @builder.
The given `GdkContentFormatsBuilder` is reset once this function returns; you cannot call this function multiple times on the same @builder instance.
This function is intended primarily for bindings. C code should use [method@Gdk.ContentFormatsBuilder.free_to_formats].
function.return: the newly created `GdkContentFormats` with all the formats added to @builder

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_unref
function.description: Releases a reference on the given @builder.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_contain_gtype
function.description: Checks if a given `GType` is part of the given @formats.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_contain_mime_type
function.description: Checks if a given mime type is part of the given @formats.

parameter.name: mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: the mime type to search for

function.name: gdk_content_formats_get_gtypes
function.description:
Gets the `GType`s included in @formats.
Note that @formats may not contain any `GType`s, in particular when they are empty. In that case %NULL will be returned.

parameter.name: n_gtypes
parameter.parameter_description: optional pointer to take the number of `GType`s contained in the return value

function.name: gdk_content_formats_get_mime_types
function.description:
Gets the mime types included in @formats.
Note that @formats may not contain any mime types, in particular when they are empty. In that case %NULL will be returned.

parameter.name: n_mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: optional pointer to take the number of mime types contained in the return value

function.return: %NULL-terminated array of interned strings of mime types included in @formats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match
function.description: Checks if @first and @second have any matching formats.
function.return: %TRUE if a matching format was found.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match_gtype
function.description:
Finds the first `GType` from @first that is also contained in @second.
If no matching `GType` is found, %G_TYPE_INVALID is returned.
function.return: The first common `GType` or %G_TYPE_INVALID if none.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match_mime_type
function.description:
Finds the first mime type from @first that is also contained in @second.
If no matching mime type is found, %NULL is returned.
function.return: The first common mime type or %NULL if none

function.name: gdk_content_formats_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GdkContentFormats` from an array of mime types.
The mime types must be valid and different from each other or the behavior of the return value is undefined. If you cannot guarantee this, use [struct@Gdk.ContentFormatsBuilder] instead.

parameter.name: mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to an array of mime types

function.name: gdk_content_formats_new_for_gtype
function.description: Creates a new `GdkContentFormats` for a given `GType`.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_parse
function.description:
Parses the given @string into `GdkContentFormats` and returns the formats.
Strings printed via [method@Gdk.ContentFormats.to_string] can be read in again successfully using this function.
If @string does not describe valid content formats, %NULL is returned.
Since: 4.4
function.return: the content formats if @string is valid

function.name: gdk_content_formats_print
function.description:
Prints the given @formats into a string for human consumption.
The result of this function can later be parsed with [func@Gdk.ContentFormats.parse].

function.name: gdk_content_formats_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of a `GdkContentFormats` by one.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_to_string
function.description:
Prints the given @formats into a human-readable string.
The resulting string can be parsed with [func@Gdk.ContentFormats.parse].
This is a small wrapper around [method@Gdk.ContentFormats.print] to help when debugging.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union
function.description: Append all missing types from @second to @first, in the order they had in @second.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_deserialize_gtypes
function.description:
Add GTypes for mime types in @formats for which deserializers are registered.
Return: a new `GdkContentFormats`

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_deserialize_mime_types
function.description:
Add mime types for GTypes in @formats for which deserializers are registered.
Return: a new `GdkContentFormats`

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_serialize_gtypes
function.description:
Add GTypes for the mime types in @formats for which serializers are registered.
Return: a new `GdkContentFormats`

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_serialize_mime_types
function.description:
Add mime types for GTypes in @formats for which serializers are registered.
Return: a new `GdkContentFormats`

function.name: gdk_content_formats_unref
function.description:
Decreases the reference count of a `GdkContentFormats` by one.
If the resulting reference count is zero, frees the formats.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_content_changed
function.description: Emits the ::content-changed signal.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_get_value
function.description:
Gets the contents of @provider stored in @value.
The @value will have been initialized to the `GType` the value should be provided in. This given `GType` does not need to be listed in the formats returned by [method@Gdk.ContentProvider.ref_formats]. However, if the given `GType` is not supported, this operation can fail and `G_IO_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED` will be reported.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a `GError` location to store the error occurring

function.return: %TRUE if the value was set successfully. Otherwise @error will be set to describe the failure.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_for_bytes
function.description: Create a content provider that provides the given @bytes as data for the given @mime_type.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_for_value
function.description: Create a content provider that provides the given @value.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_typed
function.description:
Create a content provider that provides the value of the given @type.
The value is provided using G_VALUE_COLLECT(), so the same rules apply as when calling g_object_new() or g_object_set().

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_union

parameter.name: providers
parameter.parameter_description: The `GdkContentProvider`s to present the union of

function.name: gdk_content_provider_ref_formats
function.description: Gets the formats that the provider can provide its current contents in.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_ref_storable_formats
function.description:
Gets the formats that the provider suggests other applications to store the data in.
An example of such an application would be a clipboard manager.
This can be assumed to be a subset of [method@Gdk.ContentProvider.ref_formats].
function.return: The storable formats of the provider

function.name: gdk_content_provider_write_mime_type_async
function.description:
Asynchronously writes the contents of @provider to @stream in the given @mime_type.
The given mime type does not need to be listed in the formats returned by [method@Gdk.ContentProvider.ref_formats]. However, if the given `GType` is not supported, `G_IO_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED` will be reported.
The given @stream will not be closed.

parameter.name: mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: the mime type to provide the data in

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function
