parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the bounds of the transformed rectangle

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_box
function.description:
Transforms the vertices of a #graphene_box_t using the given matrix @m.
The result is the axis aligned bounding box containing the transformed vertices.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the bounds of the transformed box

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_point
function.description:
Transforms the given #graphene_point_t using the matrix @m.
Unlike graphene_matrix_transform_vec3(), this function will take into account the fourth row vector of the #graphene_matrix_t when computing the dot product of each row vector of the matrix.
See also: graphene_simd4x4f_point3_mul()
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_point3d
function.description:
Transforms the given #graphene_point3d_t using the matrix @m.
Unlike graphene_matrix_transform_vec3(), this function will take into account the fourth row vector of the #graphene_matrix_t when computing the dot product of each row vector of the matrix.
See also: graphene_simd4x4f_point3_mul()
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_ray
function.description:
Transform a #graphene_ray_t using the given matrix @m.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the transformed ray

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_rect
function.description:
Transforms each corner of a #graphene_rect_t using the given matrix @m.
The result is a coplanar quadrilateral.
See also: graphene_matrix_transform_point()
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the transformed quad

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_sphere
function.description:
Transforms a #graphene_sphere_t using the given matrix @m. The result is the bounding sphere containing the transformed sphere.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the bounds of the transformed sphere

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_vec3
function.description:
Transforms the given #graphene_vec3_t using the matrix @m.
This function will multiply the X, Y, and Z row vectors of the matrix @m with the corresponding components of the vector @v. The W row vector will be ignored.
See also: graphene_simd4x4f_vec3_mul()
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_matrix_transform_vec4
function.description:
Transforms the given #graphene_vec4_t using the matrix @m.
See also: graphene_simd4x4f_vec4_mul()
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_matrix_translate
function.description:
Adds a translation transformation to @m using the coordinates of the given #graphene_point3d_t.
This is the equivalent of calling graphene_matrix_init_translate() and then multiplying @m with the translation matrix.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_matrix_transpose
function.description:
Transposes the given matrix.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the transposed matrix

function.name: graphene_matrix_unproject_point3d
function.description:
Unprojects the given @point using the @projection matrix and a @modelview matrix.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: modelview
parameter.parameter_description: a #graphene_matrix_t for the modelview matrix; this is the inverse of the modelview used when projecting the point

parameter.name: point
parameter.parameter_description: a #graphene_point3d_t with the coordinates of the point

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the unprojected point

function.name: graphene_matrix_untransform_bounds
function.description:
Undoes the transformation on the corners of a #graphene_rect_t using the given matrix, within the given axis aligned rectangular @bounds.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the untransformed rectangle

function.name: graphene_matrix_untransform_point
function.description:
Undoes the transformation of a #graphene_point_t using the given matrix, within the given axis aligned rectangular @bounds.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the untransformed point

function.return: `true` if the point was successfully untransformed

function.name: graphene_plane_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_plane_t structure.
The contents of the returned structure are undefined.
Since: 1.2
function.return: the newly allocated #graphene_plane_t. Use graphene_plane_free() to free the resources allocated by this function

function.name: graphene_plane_distance
function.description:
Computes the distance of @point from a #graphene_plane_t.
Since: 1.2
function.return: the distance of the given #graphene_point3d_t from the plane

function.name: graphene_plane_equal
function.description:
Checks whether the two given #graphene_plane_t are equal.
Since: 1.2
function.return: `true` if the given planes are equal

function.name: graphene_plane_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by graphene_plane_alloc().
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_plane_get_constant
function.description:
Retrieves the distance along the normal vector of the given #graphene_plane_t from the origin.
Since: 1.2
function.return: the constant value of the plane

function.name: graphene_plane_get_normal
function.description:
Retrieves the normal vector pointing towards the origin of the given #graphene_plane_t.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: normal
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the normal vector

function.name: graphene_plane_init
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_plane_t using the given @normal vector and @constant values.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: normal
parameter.parameter_description: a unit length normal vector defining the plane pointing towards the origin; if unset, we use the X axis by default

parameter.name: constant
parameter.parameter_description: the distance from the origin to the plane along the normal vector; the sign determines the half-space occupied by the plane

function.name: graphene_plane_init_from_plane
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_plane_t using the normal vector and constant of another #graphene_plane_t.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_plane_init_from_point
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_plane_t using the given normal vector and an arbitrary co-planar point.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: normal
parameter.parameter_description: a normal vector defining the plane pointing towards the origin

function.name: graphene_plane_init_from_points
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_plane_t using the 3 provided co-planar points.
The winding order is counter-clockwise, and determines which direction the normal vector will point.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_plane_init_from_vec4
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_plane_t using the components of the given #graphene_vec4_t vector.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: a #graphene_vec4_t containing the normal vector in its first three components, and the distance in its fourth component

function.name: graphene_plane_negate
function.description:
Negates the normal vector and constant of a #graphene_plane_t, effectively mirroring the plane across the origin.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the negated plane

function.name: graphene_plane_normalize
function.description:
Normalizes the vector of the given #graphene_plane_t, and adjusts the constant accordingly.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the normalized plane

function.name: graphene_plane_transform
function.description:
Transforms a #graphene_plane_t @p using the given @matrix and @normal_matrix.
If @normal_matrix is %NULL, a transformation matrix for the plane normal will be computed from @matrix. If you are transforming multiple planes using the same @matrix it's recommended to compute the normal matrix beforehand to avoid incurring in the cost of recomputing it every time.
Since: 1.10

function.name: graphene_point3d_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a #graphene_point3d_t structure.
Since: 1.0
function.return: the newly allocated structure. Use graphene_point3d_free() to free the resources allocated by this function.

function.name: graphene_point3d_cross
function.description:
Computes the cross product of the two given #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the cross product

function.name: graphene_point3d_distance
function.description:
Computes the distance between the two given #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: delta
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the distance components on the X, Y, and Z axis

function.name: graphene_point3d_dot
function.description:
Computes the dot product of the two given #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.0
function.return: the value of the dot product

function.name: graphene_point3d_equal
function.description:
Checks whether two given points are equal.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated via graphene_point3d_alloc().
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_init
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_point3d_t with the given coordinates.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the X coordinate of the point

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the Y coordinate of the point

parameter.name: z
parameter.parameter_description: the Z coordinate of the point

function.name: graphene_point3d_init_from_point
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_point3d_t using the coordinates of another #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_init_from_vec3
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_point3d_t using the components of a #graphene_vec3_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_interpolate
function.description:
Linearly interpolates each component of @a and @b using the provided @factor, and places the result in @res.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the interpolated #graphene_point3d_t

function.name: graphene_point3d_length
function.description:
Computes the length of the vector represented by the coordinates of the given #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.0
function.return: the length of the vector represented by the point

function.name: graphene_point3d_near
function.description:
Checks whether the two points are near each other, within an @epsilon factor.
Since: 1.0
function.return: `true` if the points are near each other

function.name: graphene_point3d_normalize
function.description:
Computes the normalization of the vector represented by the coordinates of the given #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_normalize_viewport
function.description:
Normalizes the coordinates of a #graphene_point3d_t using the given viewport and clipping planes.
The coordinates of the resulting #graphene_point3d_t will be in the [ -1, 1 ] range.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: z_near
parameter.parameter_description: the coordinate of the near clipping plane, or 0 for the default near clipping plane

parameter.name: z_far
parameter.parameter_description: the coordinate of the far clipping plane, or 1 for the default far clipping plane

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the normalized #graphene_point3d_t

function.name: graphene_point3d_scale
function.description:
Scales the coordinates of the given #graphene_point3d_t by the given @factor.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the scaled point

function.name: graphene_point3d_to_vec3
function.description:
Stores the coordinates of a #graphene_point3d_t into a #graphene_vec3_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point3d_zero
function.description:
Retrieves a constant point with all three coordinates set to 0.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point_alloc
function.return: the newly allocated #graphene_point_t. Use graphene_point_free() to free the resources allocated by this function.

function.name: graphene_point_distance
function.description:
Computes the distance between @a and @b.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: d_x
parameter.parameter_description: distance component on the X axis

parameter.name: d_y
parameter.parameter_description: distance component on the Y axis

function.return: the distance between the two points

function.name: graphene_point_distance_squared
function.description:
Computes the squared distance between @a and @b.
Since: 1.12
function.return: the distance between the two points, squared

function.name: graphene_point_equal
function.description:
Checks if the two points @a and @b point to the same coordinates.
This function accounts for floating point fluctuations; if you want to control the fuzziness of the match, you can use graphene_point_near() instead.
Since: 1.0
function.return: `true` if the points have the same coordinates

function.name: graphene_point_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by graphene_point_alloc().
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point_init
function.description:
Initializes @p to the given @x and @y coordinates.
It's safe to call this function multiple times.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point_init_from_point
function.description:
Initializes @p with the same coordinates of @src.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point_init_from_vec2
function.description:
Initializes @p with the coordinates inside the given #graphene_vec2_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_point_interpolate
function.description:
Linearly interpolates the coordinates of @a and @b using the given @factor.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the interpolated point

function.name: graphene_point_near
function.description:
Checks whether the two points @a and @b are within the threshold of @epsilon.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_point_to_vec2
function.description:
Stores the coordinates of the given #graphene_point_t into a #graphene_vec2_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_point_zero
function.description:
Returns a point fixed at (0, 0).
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quad_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_quad_t instance.
The contents of the returned instance are undefined.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quad_bounds
function.description:
Computes the bounding rectangle of @q and places it into @r.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quad_contains
function.description:
Checks if the given #graphene_quad_t contains the given #graphene_point_t.
Since: 1.0
function.return: `true` if the point is inside the #graphene_quad_t

function.name: graphene_quad_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by graphene_quad_alloc()
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quad_get_point
function.description:
Retrieves the point of a #graphene_quad_t at the given index.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the point to retrieve

function.name: graphene_quad_init
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quad_t with the given points.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: p1
parameter.parameter_description: the first point of the quadrilateral

parameter.name: p2
parameter.parameter_description: the second point of the quadrilateral

parameter.name: p3
parameter.parameter_description: the third point of the quadrilateral

parameter.name: p4
parameter.parameter_description: the fourth point of the quadrilateral

function.name: graphene_quad_init_from_points
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quad_t using an array of points.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_quad_init_from_rect
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quad_t using the four corners of the given #graphene_rect_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_add
function.description:
Adds two #graphene_quaternion_t @a and @b.
Since: 1.10

function.name: graphene_quaternion_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_quaternion_t.
The contents of the returned value are undefined.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_dot
function.description:
Computes the dot product of two #graphene_quaternion_t.
Since: 1.0
function.return: the value of the dot products

function.name: graphene_quaternion_equal
function.description:
Checks whether the given quaternions are equal.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_free
function.description:
Releases the resources allocated by graphene_quaternion_alloc().
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the given four values.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the first component of the quaternion

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the second component of the quaternion

parameter.name: z
parameter.parameter_description: the third component of the quaternion

parameter.name: w
parameter.parameter_description: the fourth component of the quaternion

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_angle_vec3
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using an @angle on a specific @axis.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: angle
parameter.parameter_description: the rotation on a given axis, in degrees

parameter.name: axis
parameter.parameter_description: the axis of rotation, expressed as a vector

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_angles
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the values of the [Euler angles](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler_angles) on each axis.
See also: graphene_quaternion_init_from_euler()
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: deg_x
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the X axis (yaw), in degrees

parameter.name: deg_y
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the Y axis (pitch), in degrees

parameter.name: deg_z
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the Z axis (roll), in degrees

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_euler
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the given #graphene_euler_t.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_matrix
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the rotation components of a transformation matrix.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_quaternion
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t with the values from @src.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_radians
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the values of the [Euler angles](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler_angles) on each axis.
See also: graphene_quaternion_init_from_euler()
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: rad_x
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the X axis (yaw), in radians

parameter.name: rad_y
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the Y axis (pitch), in radians

parameter.name: rad_z
parameter.parameter_description: rotation angle on the Z axis (roll), in radians

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_from_vec4
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t with the values from @src.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_init_identity
function.description:
Initializes a #graphene_quaternion_t using the identity transformation.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_invert
function.description:
Inverts a #graphene_quaternion_t, and returns the conjugate quaternion of @q.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the inverted quaternion

function.name: graphene_quaternion_multiply
function.description:
Multiplies two #graphene_quaternion_t @a and @b.
Since: 1.10

function.name: graphene_quaternion_normalize
function.description:
Normalizes a #graphene_quaternion_t.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the normalized quaternion

function.name: graphene_quaternion_scale
function.description:
Scales all the elements of a #graphene_quaternion_t @q using the given scalar factor.
Since: 1.10

function.name: graphene_quaternion_slerp
function.description:
Interpolates between the two given quaternions using a spherical linear interpolation, or [SLERP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slerp), using the given interpolation @factor.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the interpolated quaternion

function.name: graphene_quaternion_to_angle_vec3
function.description:
Converts a quaternion into an @angle, @axis pair.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: angle
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the angle, in degrees

parameter.name: axis
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation axis

function.name: graphene_quaternion_to_angles
function.description:
Converts a #graphene_quaternion_t to its corresponding rotations on the [Euler angles](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler_angles) on each axis.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: deg_x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the X axis (yaw), in degrees

parameter.name: deg_y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the Y axis (pitch), in degrees

parameter.name: deg_z
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the Z axis (roll), in degrees

function.name: graphene_quaternion_to_matrix
function.description:
Converts a quaternion into a transformation matrix expressing the rotation defined by the #graphene_quaternion_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_quaternion_to_radians
function.description:
Converts a #graphene_quaternion_t to its corresponding rotations on the [Euler angles](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler_angles) on each axis.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: rad_x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the X axis (yaw), in radians

parameter.name: rad_y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the Y axis (pitch), in radians

parameter.name: rad_z
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rotation angle on the Z axis (roll), in radians

function.name: graphene_quaternion_to_vec4
function.description:
Copies the components of a #graphene_quaternion_t into a #graphene_vec4_t.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_ray_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_ray_t structure.
The contents of the returned structure are undefined.
Since: 1.4
function.return: the newly allocated #graphene_ray_t. Use graphene_ray_free() to free the resources allocated by this function

function.name: graphene_ray_equal
function.description:
Checks whether the two given #graphene_ray_t are equal.
Since: 1.4
function.return: `true` if the given rays are equal

function.name: graphene_ray_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by graphene_ray_alloc().
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_get_closest_point_to_point
function.description:
Computes the point on the given #graphene_ray_t that is closest to the given point @p.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the closest point3d

function.name: graphene_ray_get_direction
function.description:
Retrieves the direction of the given #graphene_ray_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_get_distance_to_plane
function.description:
Computes the distance of the origin of the given #graphene_ray_t from the given plane.
If the ray does not intersect the plane, this function returns `INFINITY`.
Since: 1.4
function.return: the distance of the origin of the ray from the plane

function.name: graphene_ray_get_distance_to_point
function.description:
Computes the distance of the closest approach between the given #graphene_ray_t @r and the point @p.
The closest approach to a ray from a point is the distance between the point and the projection of the point on the ray itself.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_get_origin
function.description:
Retrieves the origin of the given #graphene_ray_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_get_position_at
function.description:
Retrieves the coordinates of a point at the distance @t along the given #graphene_ray_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_init
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_ray_t using the given @origin and @direction values.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_init_from_ray
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_ray_t using the origin and direction values of another #graphene_ray_t.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_init_from_vec3
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_ray_t using the given vectors.
Since: 1.4

function.name: graphene_ray_intersect_box
function.description:
Intersects the given #graphene_ray_t @r with the given #graphene_box_t @b.

parameter.name: t_out

function.name: graphene_ray_intersect_sphere

Intersects the given #graphene_ray_t @r with the given #graphene_sphere_t @s.
Since: 1.10

parameter.name: t_out
parameter.parameter_description: the distance of the point on the ray that intersects the sphere

function.name: graphene_ray_intersect_triangle
function.description:
Intersects the given #graphene_ray_t @r with the given #graphene_triangle_t @t.
Since: 1.10

parameter.name: t_out
parameter.parameter_description: the distance of the point on the ray that intersects the triangle

function.name: graphene_ray_intersects_box
function.description:
Checks whether the given #graphene_ray_t @r intersects the given #graphene_box_t @b.
See also: graphene_ray_intersect_box()
Since: 1.10

function.description:
Checks if the given #graphene_ray_t @r intersects the given #graphene_sphere_t @s.

Since: 1.10

function.description:
Checks whether the given #graphene_ray_t @r intersects the given #graphene_triangle_t @b.
See also: graphene_ray_intersect_triangle()
Since: 1.10
function.return: `true` if the ray intersects the triangle

function.name: graphene_rect_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_rect_t.
The contents of the returned rectangle are undefined.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_contains_point
function.description:
Checks whether a #graphene_rect_t contains the given coordinates.
Since: 1.0
function.return: `true` if the rectangle contains the point

function.name: graphene_rect_contains_rect
function.description:
Checks whether a #graphene_rect_t fully contains the given rectangle.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_equal
function.description:
Checks whether the two given rectangle are equal.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_expand

function.name: graphene_rect_init
function.description:
Initializes the given #graphene_rect_t with the given values.
This function will implicitly normalize the #graphene_rect_t before returning.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_init_from_rect
function.description:
Initializes @r using the given @src rectangle.
This function will implicitly normalize the #graphene_rect_t before returning.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_inset
function.description:
Changes the given rectangle to be smaller, or larger depending on the given inset parameters.
To create an inset rectangle, use positive @d_x or @d_y values; to create a larger, encompassing rectangle, use negative @d_x or @d_y values.
The origin of the rectangle is offset by @d_x and @d_y, while the size is adjusted by `(2 * @d_x, 2 * @d_y)`. If @d_x and @d_y are positive values, the size of the rectangle is decreased; if @d_x and @d_y are negative values, the size of the rectangle is increased.
If the size of the resulting inset rectangle has a negative width or height then the size will be set to zero.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_inset_r
function.description:
Changes the given rectangle to be smaller, or larger depending on the given inset parameters.
To create an inset rectangle, use positive @d_x or @d_y values; to create a larger, encompassing rectangle, use negative @d_x or @d_y values.
The origin of the rectangle is offset by @d_x and @d_y, while the size is adjusted by `(2 * @d_x, 2 * @d_y)`. If @d_x and @d_y are positive values, the size of the rectangle is decreased; if @d_x and @d_y are negative values, the size of the rectangle is increased.
If the size of the resulting inset rectangle has a negative width or height then the size will be set to zero.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the inset rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_interpolate
function.description:
Linearly interpolates the origin and size of the two given rectangles.
Since: 1.0

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the interpolated rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_intersection
function.description:
Computes the intersection of the two given rectangles.
![](rectangle-intersection.png)
The intersection in the image above is the blue outline.
If the two rectangles do not intersect, @res will contain a degenerate rectangle with origin in (0, 0) and a size of 0.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_normalize
function.description:
Normalizes the passed rectangle.
This function ensures that the size of the rectangle is made of positive values, and that the origin is the top-left corner of the rectangle.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_normalize_r
function.description:
Normalizes the passed rectangle.
This function ensures that the size of the rectangle is made of positive values, and that the origin is in the top-left corner of the rectangle.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the normalized rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_offset
function.description:
Offsets the origin by @d_x and @d_y.
The size of the rectangle is unchanged.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_offset_r
function.description:
Offsets the origin of the given rectangle by @d_x and @d_y.
The size of the rectangle is left unchanged.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the offset rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_round
function.description:
Rounds the origin and size of the given rectangle to their nearest integer values; the rounding is guaranteed to be large enough to have an area bigger or equal to the original rectangle, but might not fully contain its extents. Use graphene_rect_round_extents() in case you need to round to a rectangle that covers fully the original one.
This function is the equivalent of calling `floor` on the coordinates of the origin, and `ceil` on the size.
Since: 1.4
Deprecated: 1.10: Use graphene_rect_round_extents() instead

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rounded rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_round_extents
function.description:
Rounds the origin of the given rectangle to its nearest integer value and and recompute the size so that the rectangle is large enough to contain all the conrners of the original rectangle.
This function is the equivalent of calling `floor` on the coordinates of the origin, and recomputing the size calling `ceil` on the bottom-right coordinates.
If you want to be sure that the rounded rectangle completely covers the area that was covered by the original rectangle — i.e. you want to cover the area including all its corners — this function will make sure that the size is recomputed taking into account the ceiling of the coordinates of the bottom-right corner. If the difference between the original coordinates and the coordinates of the rounded rectangle is greater than the difference between the original size and and the rounded size, then the move of the origin would not be compensated by a move in the anti-origin, leaving the corners of the original rectangle outside the rounded one.
Since: 1.10

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the rectangle with rounded extents

function.name: graphene_rect_round_to_pixel
function.description:
Rounds the origin and the size of the given rectangle to their nearest integer values; the rounding is guaranteed to be large enough to contain the original rectangle.
Since: 1.0
Deprecated: 1.4: Use graphene_rect_round() instead

function.name: graphene_rect_scale
function.description:
Scales the size and origin of a rectangle horizontaly by @s_h, and vertically by @s_v. The result @res is normalized.
Since: 1.10

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the scaled rectangle

function.name: graphene_rect_union
function.description:
Computes the union of the two given rectangles.
![](rectangle-union.png)
The union in the image above is the blue outline.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_rect_zero

Returns a degenerate rectangle with origin fixed at (0, 0) and a size of 0, 0.

function.name: graphene_simd4f_add

Creates a new #graphene_simd4f_t vector where each component is the sum of the respective components in @a and @b.

Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_simd4f_ceil
function.description:
Rounds each component of the vector @s up to the nearest integer value.
Since: 1.12

function.name: graphene_simd4f_cmp_ge

Since: 1.0
function.return: `true` if vector @a is greater than or equal to @b

function.name: graphene_simd4f_cmp_gt
function.description:
Compares two #graphene_simd4f_t and checks if all components of the vector @a are greater than the respective components of the vector @b.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_simd4f_cmp_le

function.return: `true` if vector @a is less than or equal to @b

function.name: graphene_simd4f_cmp_lt
function.description:

function.name: graphene_simd4f_cross3

|[<!-- language="plain" --> { .x = 1.0 / sqrt (s.x), .y = 1.0 / sqrt (s.y), .z = 1.0 / sqrt (s.z), .w = 1.0 / sqrt (s.w) } ]|

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_area

Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_barycoords
function.description:
Computes the [barycentric coordinates](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barycentric_coordinate_system) of the given point @p.
The point @p must lie on the same plane as the triangle @t; if the point is not coplanar, the result of this function is undefined.
If we place the origin in the coordinates of the triangle's A point, the barycentric coordinates are `u`, which is on the AC vector; and `v` which is on the AB vector:
![](triangle-barycentric.png)
The returned #graphene_vec2_t contains the following values, in order:
- `res.x = u` - `res.y = v`
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the vector with the barycentric coordinates

function.return: `true` if the barycentric coordinates are valid

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_bounding_box
function.description:
Computes the bounding box of the given #graphene_triangle_t.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_midpoint
function.description:
Computes the coordinates of the midpoint of the given #graphene_triangle_t.
The midpoint G is the [centroid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centroid#Triangle_centroid) of the triangle, i.e. the intersection of its medians.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the coordinates of the midpoint

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_normal
function.description:
Computes the normal vector of the given #graphene_triangle_t.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the normal vector

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_plane
function.description:
Computes the plane based on the vertices of the given #graphene_triangle_t.
Since: 1.2

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_points
function.description:
Retrieves the three vertices of the given #graphene_triangle_t and returns their coordinates as #graphene_point3d_t.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: a
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the coordinates of the first vertex

parameter.name: b
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the coordinates of the second vertex

parameter.name: c
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the coordinates of the third vertex

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_uv
function.description:
Computes the UV coordinates of the given point @p.
The point @p must lie on the same plane as the triangle @t; if the point is not coplanar, the result of this function is undefined. If @p is %NULL, the point will be set in (0, 0, 0).
The UV coordinates will be placed in the @res vector:
- `res.x = u` - `res.y = v`
See also: graphene_triangle_get_barycoords()
Since: 1.10

parameter.name: uv_a
parameter.parameter_description: the UV coordinates of the first point

parameter.name: uv_b
parameter.parameter_description: the UV coordinates of the second point

parameter.name: uv_c
parameter.parameter_description: the UV coordinates of the third point

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: a vector containing the UV coordinates of the given point @p

function.name: graphene_triangle_get_vertices
function.description:
Retrieves the three vertices of the given #graphene_triangle_t.

parameter.name: a
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the first vertex

parameter.name: b
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the second vertex

parameter.name: c
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the third vertex

function.description:
Adds each component of the two passed vectors and places each result into the components of @res.

function.name: graphene_vec2_alloc
function.description:
Allocates a new #graphene_vec2_t structure.
The contents of the returned structure are undefined.
Use graphene_vec2_init() to initialize the vector.
Since: 1.0
function.return: the newly allocated #graphene_vec2_t structure. Use graphene_vec2_free() to free the resources allocated by this function.

function.name: graphene_vec2_divide
function.description:
Divides each component of the first operand @a by the corresponding component of the second operand @b, and places the results into the vector @res.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_vec2_dot
function.description:
Computes the dot product of the two given vectors.
Since: 1.0

function.name: graphene_vec2_equal
function.description:
Checks whether the two given #graphene_vec2_t are equal.
Since: 1.2
function.return: `true` if the two vectors are equal, and false otherwise

function.name: graphene_vec2_free
function.description:
Frees the resources allocated by @v
Since: 1.0
